answers.answer: I'm plus size and I've had no complications whatsoever..I don't have gestational diabetes I don't have high blood pressure nothing..and I've barely put on weight I've only put on between 5-6 pounds..I'm currently 2 days past my due date but this pregnancy has been perfect

I was plus size with my first I ended up have gd and many complications from that had a baby #1 and dropped 140 lbs and now 30 wks with bby #2 and no complications besides my placenta is low but hopefully Thursday I find out its moved!  :) good luck anything can happen plus size or not!

I'm 22 weeks and I'm plus size, before pregnancy I had high blood pressure and high cholesterol, but I was loosing weight so cholesterol is normal now, but now with pregnancy I have gestational diabetes, and I'm using insulin but is stabilized with the medicine, I walk 10 mins after each meal, and my blood pressure is good, and I haven't gain too much weight, just 11 lbs cause during the first trimester I lost weight, so I'm doing good

I am pregnant with my 2nd & am plus sized was also plus sized with my 1st & had zero complications. I am 21 weeks now & have not had any complications so far, but trying to make sure I eat good & not gain to much weight. I think really all depends on your body & how well you take care of yourself. I hope everything goes well at your dr. app.

I'm a plus size mommy on my second pregnancy and I didn't have any complications with my first pregnancy. Don't stress enjoy your pregnancy! Your doctor will guide you in every way to avoid any complications. Don't worry, being stressed, worried or anxious can bring complications so just Relax mama!
I'm plus size and to be honest my baby came at 34 weeks

I am plus sized, my first pregnancy was high risk, I developed preeclampsia and put on a ton of water weight and ended up with a csection but a perfectly healthy beautiful baby girl. Now I'm pregnant with baby 2 and so far no major issues bp is doing good but I'm closely monitored just to be safe :) good luck momma

I'm plus size with my first pregnancy and so far everything is going the way it should..just be confident that everything will be okay and take care of yourself the way the doctor says and you'll be fine :)
I am plus size & I am 33weeks. I've gained 15 pounds and a lot of it is water weight. I haven't had any issues. No Diabetes or hypertension. Everything is going well 7 weeks too go! Good luck.

I'm plus sized and no complications so far with 11 weeks to go! No weight gain, diabetes, or hypertension only normal pregnancy symptoms like back pain and feet swelling because I work on my feet for 8 hrs a day at least 4 days a week.

I'm 31 weeks & I'm  overweight too & I have had a breeze of a pregnancy. I've had almost no symptoms except heartburn, a little swelling & fatique that comes & goes. My baby is healthy, measuring right on time & I have not had one complication & I started my pregnancy with severe PCOS. At this point, even my ovaries are clear of cysts. Complications don't just come from being overweight. I wouldn't worry unless a problem comes up

With my first, my starting weight was 226 at only 5'1. My blood pressure was never high, I didn't have GD. I did end up having gallbladder attacks which I blame on my poor diet, lol. I had a c-section but not sure to my weight.

Thanks ladies. The reason I was asking was I had a regular Pap smear on 6/4/14 and the doctor asked if I was trying to conceive and I said yes. She looked at me and said conception isn't possible at my size well 2 weeks later I had 3 positive pregnancy tests. I beat myself up for 2 whole weeks thinking I was never going to be a mother and ignored every pregnancy symptom I had because it was not possible. Tomorrow I have my first appointment and im worried something wrong be right all because that woman said I couldnt conceive. :( I want to be excited but not until after I see that we are okay. But thank you all for the wonderful news that us bigger chicks can have healthy pregnancies and healthy babies.

question: Did or does anyone have any complications with or during their pregnancy (ies)? Im 26 and almost 8 weeks my apt is Wednesday.  Im nervous.
title: plus size mommies
